tit.e: Kyomi-toge Pass (a pass in Kita Ward, Kyoto City)
Kyomi-toge Pass (a pass in Kita Ward, Kyoto City)

sen.j: 京見峠（きょうみとうげ）は京都府京都市北区 (京都市)にある峠である。
sen.e: Kyomi-toge Pass is the pass that runs in Kita Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Kyomi-toge Pass is the pass that runs in Kita Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Kyomi-toge Pass is the pass that runs in Kita Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

tit.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 標高446mの京都府道31号西陣杉坂線上に位置する峠である。
sen.e: It runs on the Nishijin-Sugisaka Route, Kyoto Prefectural Road 31 at the height above sea level of 446m.
It is located on Kyoto Prefectural Road 31 Nishijin-Sugisaka Line, at an altitude of 446 meters.
It is located on Kyoto Prefectural Road 31 Nishijin-Sugisaka Line, at an altitude of 446 meters.

sen.j: 京都市北区西賀茂鑓磨岩と同区大宮釈迦谷とを隔てている。
sen.e: It marks the border between Nishigamo Yaritogiiwa, Kita Ward Kyoto City, and Omiya Shakadani of the same ward.
It separates Nishigamo-yaritogiiwa, Kita Ward, Kyoto City, and Omiya-shakadani of the same ward.
It separates Nishigamo-yaritogiiwa, Kita Ward, Kyoto City, and Omiya-shakadani of the same ward.

sen.j: 上洛する際、最も初めに京都の街を見下ろすことが出来た峠として知られている。
sen.e: Upon going to the center of Kyoto, this is the pass where one can take the first glimpse of the town of Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Upon going to the center of Kyoto, this was the pass where one could take the first glimpse of the town of Kyoto.
Upon going to the center of Kyoto, this was the pass where one could take the first glimpse of the town of Kyoto.

sen.j: そこからこの名がついたという伝承が残っている。
sen.e: That's how the pass is named as such.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There is a lore that this is how the pass is named as such.
There is a lore that this is how the pass is named as such.

sen.j: 京見茶屋という茶屋が峠に残っており、古くからの峠としての歴史を今尚深く残している。
sen.e: A chaya (rest house) called Kyomi Jaya is still there at the pass, showing the history of the pass that has been one of the oldest in the area.
A chaya (rest house) called Kyomi Jaya is still there at the pass, showing the history of the pass that has been one of the oldest in the area.
A chaya (rest house) called Kyomi Jaya is still there at the pass, showing the history of the pass that has been one of the oldest in the area.

sen.j: 車両での通行が可能な峠である。
sen.e: The pass allows automobiles traffic.
The pass is travelable for vehicles.
The pass is travelable for vehicles.

sen.j: 隣接する峠同様、非常に狭路であり、ヘアピンカーブの膨らみを利用して離合するしかないような区間も在る。
sen.e: Similar to the passes adjacent to it, Kyomi Pass is a very narrow road with several spots where you can pass an oncoming car only at where the hair-pin curves are.
Similar to the passes adjacent to it, Kyomi-toge Pass is a very narrow road with several spots where you can pass an oncoming car only at where the hair-pin curves are.
Similar to the passes adjacent to it, Kyomi-toge Pass is a very narrow road with several spots where you can pass an oncoming car only at where the hair-pin curves are.

sen.j: しかし2009年現在夜景スポットとして人気があり、京都市街地から比較的近いこともあり、交通量は道幅と比較して非常に多い。
sen.e: As of 2009, it is a popular spot for its nice night view and, since it is relatively close from the center of Kyoto City, the traffic is pretty heavy for the narrowness of the road.
As of 2009, it is a popular spot for its nice night view and, since it is relatively close from the center of Kyoto City, the traffic is pretty heavy for the narrowness of the road.
As of 2009, it is a popular spot for its nice night view and, since it is relatively close from the center of Kyoto City, the traffic is pretty heavy for the narrowness of the road.

sen.j: 夜間に渋滞することもあり、道路の改善が望まれている。
sen.e: The pass sometimes gets congested during the night and it is hoped that they do something to improve the traffic.
The pass sometimes gets congested during the night and it is hoped to improve the traffic.
The pass sometimes gets congested during the night and it is hoped to improve the traffic.
